result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ian Joseph Desrosier in court.  Prosecuting attorney Kristian Kanekoa Lindo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant unable to complete driver safety program; must go through treatment. Defendant continues waiver of counsel.
Hearing scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

Prosecuting Attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ian Joseph Desrosier in court without counsel.  Defendant has not yet reinstated his driver's license.  Not guilty plea entered by Court.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Plea hearing on October 27, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

Prosecuting Attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ian Joseph Desrosier in court without counsel. (22TR1351 tagging along)  Defendant given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Defendant waives right to attorney.  $500 signature bond set.  Adjourned to allow defendant to reinstate his driver's license.
Plea hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Plea hearing on September 21, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Initial appearance on July 11, 2022 at 08:15 am.
